title: How to clean pen ink stains out of my clothes - Quora

response.answer_text: Wash ? Hardly… ink is oil & dye You must attack one then the other First the oil .. there are on the shelf products in the laundry section of most retailers for this problem .. but assuming your on your own buy a bar of Ivory soap ( it floats in water ) because it’s soft rub some on the ink spot . Now add a little water and create a paste with a spoon gently using the edge work the paste back and forth until it’s bluish keep working gently work back and forth now rinse in cold water repeat until all the oil is gone …… now the dye ( blue or black ink .) for white a q tip of bleach is enough but pastels use vinegar with the bar of soap back and forth with the spoon gently . Rewash cold

So much depends on what kind of ink it is. A lot of inks today are permanent dyes and nothing will remove them. Whether it’s printer ink or ink from a pen, if it is a permanent dye, it’s there to stay. Old style ball point pen ink may come out with some alcohol. or hair spray, and it used to be possible to buy something called “WINK” that did an amazing job on ball point pen ink. But I haven’t seen any Wink in a long, long time.
